page.title: 11Queen Alexandra Hospital
page.content: Queen Alexandra Hospital had its first patients on 10th March 1908 when the first 100 servicemen moved in. There are three 120 bed ward floors which are divided into six, four or single bed bays. An 86 bed unit on the seventh floor treats children/ The latest aids to twentieth century medicine combine with highly skilled operating teams to restore good health. The accident and emergency department provides a 24 hour service. In a year the department recieves 55000 attendances with an average workload of 160 cases a day. More than 2000 meals are provided each day and there are homes for 150 hospital staff.
